context: The word 'kasutasin' is the first person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'kasutama', which means 'to use'. It indicates that the speaker performed the action of using something in the past. The word consists of the root 'kasuta-' (use) plus the suffix '-sin' which marks first person singular past tense. In the example sentence from the dictionary, it shows how this form is used with different objects - 'infoallikaid' (information sources).
